SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler

Interface ServerMessageReplyHandler

All Superinterfaces:
ServerReplyHandler
public interface ServerMessageReplyHandler extends ServerReplyHandler
Handler for end-of-message response.

This handler receives the server's response after the message content has been sent (after endMessage()). On success (250), the handler receives a queue ID (if provided by the server) and a ClientSession interface to send additional messages or quit.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
  • ClientMessageData.endMessage(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.handler.ServerMessageReplyHandler)

    handleServiceClosing

  • Method Details

    • handleMessageAccepted

      void handleMessageAccepted(String queueId, ClientSession session)
      Called when the message is accepted (250).

      The message has been queued for delivery. The handler can send another message or quit.

      Parameters:
      queueId - the server-assigned queue ID (may be null if not provided)
      session - operations to send another message or quit

    • handleTemporaryFailure

      void handleTemporaryFailure(ClientSession session)
      Called when the message is temporarily rejected (4xx).

      The message was not accepted but may succeed if retried later. Common reasons include:

      • 451 - Local processing error
      • 452 - Insufficient storage
      Parameters:
      session - operations to start a new transaction or quit

    • handlePermanentFailure

      void handlePermanentFailure(String message, ClientSession session)
      Called when the message is permanently rejected (5xx).

      The message content is not acceptable. Common reasons include:

      • 550 - Mailbox unavailable
      • 552 - Message size exceeds limit
      • 554 - Transaction failed
      Parameters:
      message - the server's rejection message
      session - operations to start a new transaction or quit
